articles.title: Therapeutic potential of liposome@azoramide in cancer by suppressing oxidative phosphorylation.
articles.summary:

Researchers developed a liposome-based treatment that targets cancer cell metabolism by disrupting energy production, potentially offering a new approach to combat tumor growth.

articles.title: Deep learning-derived CT body composition enhances survival risk stratification beyond the TNM system in locally advanced gastric cancer: a multi-modality cohort study.
articles.summary: A deep learning method analyzing CT scans can more accurately predict survival risks for locally advanced gastric cancer patients by measuring body composition beyond traditional staging.

articles.title: Introducing iCatalog as a clinical decision support tool for collaborative pediatric precision oncology studies.
articles.summary: iCatalog enables better pediatric cancer treatment by helping doctors collaboratively manage and interpret genomic test results across multiple research institutions.

articles.title: Predicting the Effectiveness of 2 Chemotherapy Regimens Applied to Breast Cancer Patients by Nutritional and Inflammatory Status.
articles.summary: In HER2-positive breast cancer, the TCHP chemotherapy regimen showed better overall survival compared to ddAC-THP, with the cancer-related antigen ratio (CAR) helping predict treatment response.

articles.title: Molecules and Linear Polymers With Incorporated Pillar[5]Arene Units: Enhanced Aggregation-Induced Emission and Their Applications.
articles.summary: Researchers developed new molecules using pillar[5]arene compounds that can improve fluorescence detection, potentially enhancing tumor imaging and medical diagnostics.

articles.title: Redox responsive cyclodextrin-based drug delivery systems: a special insight to glutathione responsive CD-nanosponges.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Researchers developed a specialized nanocarrier using cyclodextrin that can precisely release drugs in response to chemical changes within cells.

articles.title: CD73 restrains mutant β-catenin oncogenic activity in endometrial carcinomas.
articles.summary: CD73 limits the cancer-promoting activity of mutant β-catenin in endometrial carcinoma by sequestering the protein at the cell membrane.

articles.title: Punicalagin Alleviates Acute Liver Injury via Dual STAT1/NF-κB Inhibition and STAT3 Activation to Orchestrate M1-to-M2 Macrophage Polarization.
articles.summary: Punicalagin, a pomegranate-derived compound, reduces acute liver injury by shifting inflammatory macrophages toward a healing state through targeted molecular signaling.

articles.title: Effect Modification by Cofactors in the Impact of Body Mass Index Change on the Risk of Lung Cancer.
articles.summary: Persistent obesity and weight gain were associated with reduced lung cancer risk, while being underweight increased risk, particularly among men and smokers.

articles.title: Role of clonal lineage analysis via next-generation sequencing in identifying the origin of multiple cancers and guiding treatment options.
articles.summary: Next-generation sequencing revealed that a patient with HBOC syndrome developed four independent cancers, not metastases, guiding more precise treatment.

articles.title: Viability-Informed Single-Cell Mass Spectrometry for More Comprehensive Metabolic Analysis.
articles.summary: A label-free mass spectrometry technique accurately distinguishes live and dead colorectal cancer cells, revealing metabolic differences during chemotherapy treatment.

articles.title: Multifunctional Oral Hydrogel Containing Dual-Active Pt/Mn3O4 Nanozyme for Synergistic Pyroptosis Suppression and Gut Microenvironment Reprogramming to Alleviate Radiation Intestinal Injury.
articles.summary: A Pt/Mn3O4 nanozyme-curcumin hydrogel reduces radiation-induced intestinal injury by clearing harmful molecules, suppressing cell death, and restoring gut microbiome balance.

articles.title: Oncopreventive and Oncotherapeutic Potential of Plant Secondary Metabolites Against Gastric Cancer: A Review.
articles.summary: Plant-derived compounds like alkaloids and polyphenols show promise in inhibiting gastric cancer cell growth by targeting multiple cellular pathways and promoting cancer cell death.

articles.title: Application Advantages of MOF Materials Constructed of Different Metals in Dynamic Therapy of Tumors: Analysis and Elaboration.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) with different metal ions show promising potential for precise, multi-modal cancer treatment strategies across various therapeutic approaches.

articles.title: The IBEX knowledge-base a community resource enabling adoption and development of immunofluorescence imaging methods.
articles.summary: The IBEX Knowledge-Base provides an open-source platform for researchers to share and improve immunofluorescence imaging methods, enhancing scientific collaboration and data reliability.

articles.title: Proteins and lunasin from Glycine soja inhibited inflammation by activating the Hippo pathway through phosphorylation of YAP1 kinase.
articles.summary: Proteins from wild soybean significantly reduced inflammation by activating the Hippo pathway, potentially offering a novel approach to anti-inflammatory treatment.

articles.title: Tumor-Targeted Delivery of an EGFR Inhibitor Prodrug via Site-Specific Albumin Conjugation.
articles.summary: A lung cancer drug linked to albumin shows improved tumor targeting and effectiveness compared to the original medication, enhancing potential treatment options.

articles.title: Identifying a Novel Six-LncRNA Signature Evaluates Survival and Reveals AC129507.1 as the m6A-Target to Regulate Ferroptosis in Gastric Cancer.
articles.summary: A six-lncRNA signature in gastric cancer reveals high-risk patients, predicts lower survival rates, and identifies AC129507.1 as a key ferroptosis-related target.

articles.title: Phenothiazine alleviates cisplatin-mediated acute kidney injury by inhibiting ferroptosis.
articles.summary: Phenothiazine reduces kidney damage caused by cisplatin chemotherapy by blocking a specific cell death process called ferroptosis in mouse models.

articles.title: A Cost-Analysis and Micro-Costing Study of the Man Van Project: Comparing Prostate-Specific Antigen Testing Via a Nurse-Led Mobile Service with Primary Care.
articles.summary: A mobile healthcare service targeting prostate cancer screening in high-risk communities proved more cost-effective than traditional primary care testing methods.

articles.title: Pharmacological evaluation of mangrove plant Rhizophora mucronata (Lam.) grown in the coastal area of Sundarbans.
articles.summary: Rhizophora mucronata's ethyl acetate extract showed promising anticancer properties, inhibiting HeLa cancer cell growth and Ehrlich ascites carcinoma by up to 54.61%.

articles.title: Selective disruption of lipid peroxide homeostasis in intratumoral regulatory T cells by targeting FSP1 enhances cancer immunity.
articles.summary: Disrupting FSP1 in regulatory T cells selectively reduces their tumor-suppressing ability, potentially enhancing cancer immunity without causing autoimmune side effects.

articles.title: Bistaxascendins A-G, Abietane Diterpenoid Dimers from Taxodium ascendens, Inducing Mitophagy in Colorectal Cancer Cells.
articles.summary: Compounds 4 and 8 from Taxodium ascendens cones showed promising antiproliferative effects on colorectal cancer cells by inducing mitophagy.

articles.title: NN-01-195, a novel conjugate of HSP90 and AURKA inhibitors, effectively targets solid tumors.
articles.summary: A novel dual-targeting drug NN-01-195 effectively concentrates in solid tumors by combining AURKA and HSP90 inhibition, showing promise for cancer treatment.

articles.title: Women with moderate anaemia prior to conception benefited most from nutrition interventions: a secondary analysis of the Women First preconception maternal nutrition trial.
articles.summary: In a preconception nutrition study, women with moderate anaemia showed the most significant improvements in intrauterine growth markers from targeted nutrient supplements.

articles.title: Co-translational determination of quaternary structures in chaperone factories.
articles.summary: The R2TP chaperone assembles cellular machines by binding proteins during and after translation, creating specialized protein-RNA condensates that facilitate complex formation.

articles.title: Structural basis of co-translational N-myristoylation in humans.
articles.summary: Researchers revealed how N-myristoylation occurs during protein translation, showing that the enzyme NMT1 binds to the ribosome and modifies proteins sequentially.

articles.title: In silico evaluation of (benzo)chromeno[3,4-c]pyridine derivative as dual EGFR/HER2 inhibitors for non-small cell lung cancer.
articles.summary: Computational and experimental studies identified a promising (benzo)chromeno[3,4-c]pyridine derivative with strong potential to inhibit EGFR/HER2 in non-small cell lung cancer.

articles.title: Defining the cellular and molecular identities of histologic subtypes in lung adenocarcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Researchers identified distinct cellular and molecular characteristics of aggressive lung adenocarcinoma subtypes to better understand their potentially poor clinical outcomes.

articles.title: METTL14 knockdown mitigates HG-induced HK-2 cell apoptosis, inflammation, and ferroptosis by promoting SLC40A1.
articles.summary: In diabetic kidney disease, reducing METTL14 levels helps protect kidney cells by increasing SLC40A1 and preventing cell death mechanisms.

articles.title: Bioinformatics analysis and population sample validation of ferroptosis-related genes in coronary heart disease: A case-control study.
articles.summary: The study identified four genes associated with ferroptosis in coronary heart disease, with NOX4 showing significant upregulation and potential diagnostic value for patients.

articles.title: Ferroptosis-related gene signature predicts prognosis and immunotherapy response in hepatocellular carcinoma: A multi-cohort retrospective study.
articles.summary: A novel eight-gene signature for hepatocellular carcinoma can predict patient survival and potential immunotherapy response based on ferroptosis-related genes.

articles.title: Clinical value of ultrasound combined with the nutritional risk index in predicting the efficacy of neoadjuvant chemotherapy for breast cancer: An observational study.
articles.summary: A combined ultrasound and nutritional risk index model effectively predicts treatment response for breast cancer patients undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy.

articles.title: The effects of a (poly)phenol-rich food intervention on markers of exercise-induced inflammation and oxidative stress: A randomised controlled trial.
articles.summary: A high-(poly)phenol food intervention before strenuous exercise increased total plasma (poly)phenol levels but showed limited effects on inflammation and oxidative stress markers.

articles.title: Pure non-gestational ovarian choriocarcinoma in a postmenopausal woman coexisting with a clear cell adenofibroma and endometriosis foci: A case report and review of the literature.
articles.summary: A 72-year-old postmenopausal woman was found to have a rare, pure non-gestational ovarian choriocarcinoma alongside a clear cell adenofibroma and endometriosis.

articles.title: The inhibition of Il1β synthesis mediated by a novel pyridine-sulfonamide compound protects against the progression of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease.
articles.summary: A novel compound AIK3a305 inhibits inflammatory protein IL1β, protecting liver cells and reducing progression of metabolic fatty liver disease in preclinical models.

articles.title: Neogambogic acid promotes M-MDSC differentiation into M1 macrophages to inhibit peritoneal metastasis of colorectal cancer.
articles.summary: Neogambogic acid transforms immune-suppressing cells into tumor-fighting cells, potentially slowing the spread of colorectal cancer in the abdominal cavity.

articles.title: Dihydromyricetin improves DSS-induced colitis and behavioral disorders by regulating the microbiota-gut-brain axis balance and inhibiting the activation of NLRP3 inflammasome.
articles.summary: Dihydromyricetin effectively reduced colitis symptoms and anxiety in mice by regulating gut microbiota and suppressing inflammatory responses in the gut and brain.

articles.title: Association Between Inflammation and Risk of Cardiovascular Mortality in Cancer Survivors.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Systemic inflammation may increase cardiovascular death risk for cancer survivors, highlighting the need to understand inflammatory processes after cancer treatment.

The sentence captures the key research focus, explains the potential connection between inflammation and cardiovascular mortality, and emphasizes the broader significance of the finding.

articles.title: Predicting the Efficacy of Breast Cancer Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy Using Ultrasonography and Machine Learning.
articles.summary: A machine learning model using ultrasound images and patient data can accurately predict treatment response in breast cancer patients receiving chemotherapy before surgery.

articles.title: Oncogenic influences of neurotrophin receptors: Shedding light on Trk biology.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Trk neurotrophin receptors play a critical role in cancer development by driving abnormal cell growth, survival, and metastasis across multiple cancer types.

articles.title: Sugar-sweetened beverage warning labels and taxes: simulated impacts when considering implementation.
articles.summary: Warning labels and taxes on sugary drinks could help prevent type 2 diabetes by influencing consumer behavior and reducing sugar intake.

articles.title: SLC13 sodium-carboxylate transporters: function, regulation and pathophysiological implications in human disease.
articles.summary: SLC13 sodium-carboxylate transporters play a key role in cellular metabolism and may contribute to the development of various diseases, including cancer.

articles.title: IER3 Promotes Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Malignancy by Suppressing Ferroptosis via the AKT/GSK3β/NRF2 Pathway.
articles.summary: In non-small cell lung cancer, IER3 promotes tumor progression by blocking ferroptosis through a molecular pathway that protects cancer cells from cell death.

articles.title: Presumed Aseptic Orthopedic Implant Revisions: Unmasking Hidden Infections and Shaping Future Directions.
articles.summary: Unexpected positive cultures during orthopedic implant revisions reveal a complex diagnostic challenge, with single low-virulence cultures likely representing contamination and multiple concordant cultures indicating potential infection.

articles.title: Regional assessment of PFAS in drinking water in Miami-Dade and Palm Beach, South Florida: Implications for environmental exposure and exploratory links with liver cancer mortality.
articles.summary: A regional study of PFAS in South Florida drinking water found elevated contamination levels in Miami-Dade County, with potential but inconclusive links to liver cancer mortality.

articles.title: Exosomal IGFALS as a Prognostic Biomarker in Hepatocellular Carcinoma: Associations with Immune Infiltration and Clinical Outcomes.
articles.summary: In liver cancer, higher levels of IGFALS in cell-derived vesicles were linked to poorer patient survival and increased immune cell infiltration.

articles.title: Evaluation of the diagnostic value of DCE-MRI radiomics features and K-trans parameters in differentiating endometrial cancer from submucosal uterine fibroids.
articles.summary: Advanced MRI imaging techniques can help distinguish between endometrial cancer and uterine fibroids with improved accuracy and diagnostic precision.

articles.title: Mapping PROMIS-25 (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System Pediatric Profile) to EQ-5D-Y-3L.
articles.summary: I apologize, but the text you've provided appears to be a research methodology description about mapping patient-reported outcome measurement tools, but does not seem to describe a specific cancer research finding. Without more context about the actual research results, I cannot create a summary sentence about a cancer intervention or finding. Could you provide more details about the specific research outcomes?

articles.title: A tryptophane-phenylalanine binding motif for the histone methyltransferases MLL4 and MLL3.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered a specific protein binding motif that connects MLL4 and MLL3 methyltransferases, potentially revealing new insights into cancer-related gene regulation.

articles.title: Marine terpenoids with antimelanogenic activity from the brown alga Dictyopteris polypodioides in B16 melanoma cells.
articles.summary: Brown alga Dictyopteris polypodioides extract and specific sesquiterpene compounds effectively inhibit melanin production in melanoma cells, offering potential skin-darkening prevention.

articles.title: Dual anticancer and immunoregulatory actions of blueberry stem extract in breast cancer cells and peripheral blood mononuclear cells.
articles.summary: Blueberry stem extract suppresses breast cancer cell growth and enhances immune response by reducing cancer cell proliferation and modulating immune checkpoint proteins.

articles.title: Savolitinib plus osimertinib versus chemotherapy for advanced, EGFR mutation-positive, MET-amplified non-small-cell lung cancer in China (SACHI): interim analysis of a multicentre, open-label, phase 3 randomised controlled trial.
articles.summary: In patients with EGFR mutation-positive lung cancer and MET amplification, savolitinib plus osimertinib showed promising results compared to standard chemotherapy.

articles.title: Chromobox2 inhibition: a novel activity of alisertib, an aurora A kinase inhibitor.
articles.summary: Alisertib, an aurora A kinase inhibitor, effectively inhibits Chromobox 2 in high-grade serous carcinoma, reducing tumor spheroid formation and altering the immune microenvironment.

articles.title: DSP502 combines dual inhibition of PD-L1 and PVR to trigger anti-cancer immune responses.
articles.summary: DSP502, a novel dual-targeting protein, blocks cancer immune checkpoints PD-L1 and PVR to enhance anti-tumor immune responses across multiple cancer types.

articles.title: Heterogeneous Magnetic Resonance Nanoprobe for Assisting Liver Fibrosis Three-Dimensional Reconstruction and Cascaded Therapy.
articles.summary: A novel nanoprobe with magnetic resonance imaging and therapeutic capabilities can accurately stage liver fibrosis and provide targeted treatment to prevent disease progression.

articles.title: Promoting lifestyle medicine for supportive care in cancer: MASCC endorsement of the ACLM cancer risk reduction and survivorship toolkit.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary:

Lifestyle medicine interventions like diet, exercise, and weight management can reduce chronic disease risks for cancer survivors.

articles.title: Ferroptosis in Spine-Related Diseases: Mechanistic Insights and Potential Therapeutic Targets.
articles.summary: Ferroptosis, a cell death mechanism involving iron accumulation, may offer new insights for understanding and potentially treating spinal cord injuries and disc degeneration.

articles.title: Human Amniotic Mesenchymal Stromal Cells Promote Bone Regeneration via Regulating Ameloblastoma-Derived-Bone Marrow Mesenchymal Cells Crosstalk and Autophagy in Ameloblastoma Microenvironment.
articles.summary: Human amniotic stem cells showed potential to inhibit tumor growth and enhance bone regeneration in ameloblastoma by regulating cellular interactions and repair mechanisms.

articles.title: Circulating tumor DNA methylation and gut microbiota in colorectal cancer: diagnostic, prognostic, and therapeutic implications.
articles.summary: Circulating tumor DNA methylation and gut microbiota analysis offer promising new approaches for early detection, monitoring, and personalized treatment of colorectal cancer.

articles.title: Preclinical profiling of antibody drug conjugates targeting oncofetal chondroitin sulfate.
articles.summary: Vartumab antibody-drug conjugates targeting oncofetal chondroitin sulfate showed promising anti-tumor effects and minimal toxicity across multiple cancer types in preclinical studies.

articles.title: Splicing-driven post-translational dysregulation: a new frontier for precision cancer medicine and immunotherapy.
articles.summary: Mutations in splicing machinery can alter protein modifications in cancer, potentially changing tumor behavior and immune response.

articles.title: Development of capsaicin-derived prohibitin ligands to modulate the Aurora kinase A/PHB2 interaction and mitophagy in cancer cells.
articles.summary: A capsaicin-derived compound selectively inhibits mitophagy in breast cancer cells by targeting the interaction between Aurora kinase A and PHB2 protein.

articles.title: A single-cell derived spheroid approach to dissect intratumoural heterogeneity in colorectal cancer: cell lines show changes in proteomes and therapeutic response to 5-FU.
articles.summary: Researchers created colorectal cancer spheroids from single cells to better understand tumor diversity and response to chemotherapy by examining protein changes.

articles.title: Inhibition of the RORC/GPX4 mediated ferroptosis regulatory axis suppresses tumor growth and alleviates enzalutamide resistance in prostate cancer.
articles.summary: Ilicicolin A inhibits a specific molecular pathway in prostate cancer, potentially overcoming drug resistance and reducing tumor growth.

articles.title: Reversible Metal Coordination Switch Enables Activatable Sonodynamic Therapy via Dual-Death and Immune Synergy.
articles.summary: A switchable copper-polymer system enables selective tumor destruction by triggering multiple cell death mechanisms and enhancing immune response during sonodynamic therapy.

articles.title: A New 3D Colon on a Chip to Decipher the Influence of Mechanical Forces on the Physiological Cellular Ecosystem.
articles.summary: A stretchable 3D colon-on-chip model reveals mechanical forces significantly enhance epithelial cell proliferation and organization without changing cell differentiation.

articles.title: Synergistic Calcium Overload and Hydrogen Release Potentiate Robust Antitumor Immunity.
articles.summary: A nanoplatform delivering calcium and hydrogen effectively triggers cancer cell death and boosts immune response by transforming the tumor's suppressive environment.

articles.title: Dye-Combination Micelles for Two-Photon Phototherapy.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a targeted dye-combination micelle that uses two-photon excitation to selectively destroy colon cancer cells by simultaneously damaging multiple cellular compartments.

articles.title: Programming the Optoelectronic Properties of Atomically Precise Gold Nanoclusters Using the Conformational Landscape of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

By engineering intrinsically disordered proteins, researchers can precisely control gold nanocluster optical properties, enhancing near-infrared photoluminescence.

articles.title: STIM1 N-linked glycosylation promotes arsenic-induced malignant phenotype by activating SOCE in bladder epithelial cells.
articles.summary: Long-term arsenic exposure disrupts calcium balance in bladder cells through STIM1 glycosylation, promoting cancer-like cell transformation and growth.

articles.title: Casticin in cancer research: in vitro evidence and mechanistic insights into its antitumor potential.
articles.summary: Casticin, a natural compound, inhibits cancer cell growth by targeting multiple cellular pathways and inducing various forms of programmed cell death.

articles.title: Structure-activity relationships reveal a 4-(2-pyridyl)chalcone as a potent cell death inducer.
articles.summary: A specific chalcone compound (BHP) effectively induced cell death in leukemia cells by triggering mitochondrial apoptosis and generating reactive oxygen species.

articles.title: Kaempferol suppresses prostate cancer metastasis and tumor angiogenesis via disrupting the LIMK1/Cofilin pathway.
articles.summary: Kaempferol, a plant compound, suppresses prostate cancer metastasis by disrupting the LIMK1/Cofilin pathway, inhibiting tumor growth and angiogenesis.

articles.title: Comprehensive pharmacological insights into Glaucocalyxin A: Mechanisms and therapeutic potential.
articles.summary: Glaucocalyxin A shows promising anti-tumor potential by targeting key molecular pathways and potentially inhibiting cancer cell growth.

articles.title: Isolated Neurofibroma of the Gallbladder and Common Bile Duct Mimicking Malignancy: A Rare Case Report and Review of Literature.
articles.summary: A rare case of a neurofibroma in the gallbladder and bile duct was misdiagnosed as cancer, highlighting the importance of careful pathological examination during surgery.

articles.title: Breast Cancer Surgery Wait Times and COVID-19: A Canadian Population-Based Analysis.
articles.summary:
Here's a summary sentence:

COVID-19 pandemic delays significantly increased wait times for breast cancer surgery in Canada, potentially impacting patient outcomes.

articles.title: Alkyltriphenylphosphonium Binding to Cardiolipin Triggers Oncosis in Cancer Cells.
articles.summary: A novel mitochondrial-targeting molecule (TPP+-C14) selectively binds cardiolipin in cancer cells, disrupting mitochondrial function and triggering cell death through oncosis.

articles.title: The Shell Thickness of Polydopamine Nanocapsules Influences Protein Adsorption and Cellular Uptake.
articles.summary: Polydopamine nanocapsules with thinner shells adsorb more proteins and show enhanced cellular uptake in breast cancer cells, suggesting potential therapeutic implications.

articles.title: Lymph node upstaging in robotic, video-assisted thoracic surgery, and open lung resections: a matched analysis from the Brazilian Lung Cancer Registry.
articles.summary: Robotic lung cancer surgery showed potentially better lymph node staging compared to traditional video-assisted and open surgical techniques, according to a Brazilian registry analysis.

articles.title: Bavachinin Suppresses the Growth of Melanoma Cells by eEF2K/eEF2 Signaling and Induces Autophagy.
articles.summary: Bavachinin, a natural compound, inhibits melanoma cell growth by targeting eEF2K signaling and inducing autophagy, potentially offering a new therapeutic approach.

articles.title: Intrachromosomal insertion as a diagnostic challenge: a hidden structural rearrangement causing recurrent duplication and deletion.
articles.summary: Advanced genetic testing revealed a complex chromosomal rearrangement that can cause hidden genetic duplications and deletions, potentially impacting reproductive outcomes.

articles.title: Ultrasound-assisted extraction of endemic Stachys antalyensis: LC-ESI-MS/MS phenolic profiling and in vitro antioxidant, enzyme-inhibitory, and cytotoxicity evaluation.
articles.summary: Ultrasound-extracted Stachys antalyensis showed promising antioxidant and enzyme-inhibitory properties with low toxicity in lung cancer cell studies.

articles.title: Redox-Responsive Multimodal Nanoplatform Based on Porous Silicon Nanoparticles with Copper Silicate Layer for Synergistic Anticancer Therapy.
articles.summary: A nanoparticle platform with copper and doxorubicin targets hepatocellular cancer cells by generating reactive oxygen species and selectively accumulating in tumor cells.

articles.title: Metal-Organic Framework and 5-Fluorouracil Co-Encapsulated Hyaluronic Acid/Carboxymethyl Chitosan Hydrogels for Synergistic Chemotherapy and Enhanced Chemodynamic Therapy.
articles.summary: A novel hydrogel system combining multiple cancer-targeting molecules effectively inhibits mouse breast tumor cell growth through synergistic chemotherapy and enhanced chemical treatment.

articles.title: Tea and coffee intakes, COPD, adult asthma, and lung function in the UK Biobank.
articles.summary: Low tea and coffee intake (0.5-2 cups daily) was associated with improved lung function, reduced inflammation, and lower risk of COPD and asthma in UK Biobank participants.

articles.title: Exploration into the Antitumor Potential of Chiral Oligopeptides: a Comprehensive Study Encompassing Design, Synthesis, In Silico Target Screening and Experimental Validation.
articles.summary: Chiral oligopeptides incorporating d-tryptophan and d-proline demonstrated potent antitumor effects against human liver cancer cells by targeting PARP1 protein.

articles.title: Lactobacillus fermentum remodeled the lung microbiota by crosstalk with the gut and lungs and regulated the PI3K-AKT pathway to alleviate acute lung injury.
articles.summary: Lactobacillus fermentum reduces lung inflammation by regulating gut and lung microbiota and suppressing a key cell signaling pathway in acute lung injury.

articles.title: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene suppresses prostate cancer via apoptosis and autophagy in vitro and potent tumor growth inhibition in vivo.
articles.summary: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene, a plant compound, effectively suppresses prostate cancer growth by triggering cell death through apoptosis and autophagy.

articles.title: Discovery of a Covalent Small-Molecule eEF1A1 Inhibitor via Structure-Based Virtual Screening.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered AKOS-04, a potent small molecule inhibitor targeting eEF1A1 protein, which shows promising potential for treating pancreatic cancer.

articles.title: [Evaluation of long-term prognosis of gastric cancer patients by tumor textbook outcome and analysis of related factors].
articles.summary: In gastric cancer patients, achieving textbook oncologic outcome after surgery is associated with significantly better 3-year survival rates compared to those who do not.

articles.title: Protective effect of Rosmarinus officinalis and its nanoparticles against chemobrain and neuroinflammation in rats: involvement of Wnt/β-catenin signaling and apoptotic machineries.
articles.summary: Rosemary extract and its nanoparticles protected rats from chemotherapy-induced cognitive decline by reducing neuroinflammation and preserving brain structure.

articles.title: Glutathione-activatable bola dendrimers mediate tumor-specific cytosolic siRNA delivery via dynamic thiol-disulfide exchange.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Researchers developed a novel dendrimer that delivers RNA interference therapy specifically to lung cancer cells by exploiting tumor-specific chemical interactions.

articles.title: Impact of renal and hepatic function on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase phenotype assessed by enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and uracilemia.
articles.summary: Researchers found that kidney and liver function significantly affect how the body processes certain cancer treatment drugs by altering enzyme activity and uracil levels in blood cells.

articles.title: Clinical Implications of Aberrant Retinoblastoma Signaling in Patients With Grade 4 IDH-Mutant Astrocytoma: A Retrospective Cohort Study.
articles.summary: Grade 4 IDH-mutant astrocytoma patients with disrupted retinoblastoma signaling showed significantly worse survival outcomes compared to patients with intact signaling.

articles.title: Scaling the glassy dynamics of active particles: Tunable fragility and reentrance.
articles.summary: Research shows how self-propelled particles in dense systems can alter glass-like dynamics, potentially offering insights into complex biological processes like cancer progression.

articles.title: Bioresponsive immunomodulator nanocomplex for selective immunoengineering in metastatic lymph nodes.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

A targeted nanocomplex selectively activates T-cell responses in metastatic lymph nodes, effectively inhibiting tumor growth and improving survival.

articles.title: Caspase-3 cleaves and activates the NADase SARM1 to promote apoptosis, linking two cell death mechanisms.
articles.summary: In neuroblastoma and immune cells, caspase-3 activates SARM1, a protein that promotes cell death by breaking down NAD+ during apoptosis.

articles.title: Network toxicology and Mendelian randomization reveal pathogenic factors of monoethyl phthalate-induced thyroid cancer.
articles.summary: Researchers identified 10 genes, particularly ESR1 and SKP2, that may mediate monoethyl phthalate's role in causing thyroid cancer through molecular and genetic analysis.

articles.title: Deciphering the CAF‑LCN2 axis: Key to overcoming anti‑PD‑L1 immunotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts regulate lipocalin 2 expression, promoting lung cancer resistance to immunotherapy and suggesting a potential targeted treatment approach.

articles.title: Natural compound 5,7,8‑trimethoxyflavone mitigates radiation‑induced lung injury by suppressing EMT and PI3K/Akt pathway.
articles.summary: A natural compound 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone reduces lung inflammation and fibrosis after radiation by blocking key cellular transformation pathways.

articles.title: Force coordination distinguishes epithelial and mesenchymal modes of collective chemotaxis.
articles.summary: Mesenchymal and epithelial neural crest cell clusters use different force coordination mechanisms to migrate collectively toward a chemical signal.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: Researchers tracked the growth of antibody therapeutics in development, noting significant expansion from 26 to over 200 late-stage candidates across various medical indications.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by modulating immune cell interactions and reducing tumor aggression.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

A traditional Chinese herbal medicine called Gushen Antai recipe may help improve pregnancy success rates for women undergoing IVF by modulating immune system responses.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Specific gut microbiome compositions can enhance immune checkpoint inhibitor effectiveness in urothelial carcinoma by improving immune system response.

articles.title: Lactobacillus fermentum remodeled the lung microbiota by crosstalk with the gut and lungs and regulated the PI3K-AKT pathway to alleviate acute lung injury.
articles.summary: Lactobacillus fermentum reduced lung inflammation and injury by rebalancing gut and lung microbiota and suppressing a key inflammatory pathway.

articles.title: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene suppresses prostate cancer via apoptosis and autophagy in vitro and potent tumor growth inhibition in vivo.
articles.summary: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene effectively suppresses prostate cancer by inducing cancer cell death through coordinated apoptosis and autophagy mechanisms.

articles.title: Discovery of a Covalent Small-Molecule eEF1A1 Inhibitor via Structure-Based Virtual Screening.
articles.summary: A novel small molecule inhibitor (AKOS-04) targeting the protein eEF1A1 shows promising potential for pancreatic cancer treatment through covalent binding.

articles.title: [Evaluation of long-term prognosis of gastric cancer patients by tumor textbook outcome and analysis of related factors].
articles.summary: In gastric cancer patients, achieving textbook oncologic outcome (TOO) after surgery was associated with significantly better long-term survival rates.

articles.title: Protective effect of Rosmarinus officinalis and its nanoparticles against chemobrain and neuroinflammation in rats: involvement of Wnt/β-catenin signaling and apoptotic machineries.
articles.summary: Rosmarinus officinalis extract and nanoemulsion protected rats from oxaliplatin-induced chemobrain by reducing neuroinflammation and preserving cognitive function.

articles.title: Glutathione-activatable bola dendrimers mediate tumor-specific cytosolic siRNA delivery via dynamic thiol-disulfide exchange.
articles.summary: Glutathione-responsive bola dendrimers successfully delivered siRNA to lung cancer cells, inhibiting tumor growth with minimal side effects.

articles.title: Impact of renal and hepatic function on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase phenotype assessed by enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and uracilemia.
articles.summary: A study found that kidney and liver problems can affect enzyme activity related to how the body processes certain cancer drugs, potentially impacting treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Clinical Implications of Aberrant Retinoblastoma Signaling in Patients With Grade 4 IDH-Mutant Astrocytoma: A Retrospective Cohort Study.
articles.summary: A disruption in retinoblastoma cell signaling is linked to shorter survival in patients with grade 4 IDH-mutant brain astrocytoma.

articles.title: Scaling the glassy dynamics of active particles: Tunable fragility and reentrance.
articles.summary: Self-propelled particles in dense assemblies exhibit complex dynamic behaviors that could provide insights into biological processes like cancer progression.

articles.title: Bioresponsive immunomodulator nanocomplex for selective immunoengineering in metastatic lymph nodes.
articles.summary: A targeted nanocomplex selectively reprograms immune responses in metastatic lymph nodes, activating T cells and inhibiting tumor growth in mouse models.

articles.title: Caspase-3 cleaves and activates the NADase SARM1 to promote apoptosis, linking two cell death mechanisms.
articles.summary: Caspase-3 activates SARM1, a metabolic enzyme, during cell death in neuroblastoma and immune cells, potentially linking apoptosis and neurodegeneration.

articles.title: Network toxicology and Mendelian randomization reveal pathogenic factors of monoethyl phthalate-induced thyroid cancer.
articles.summary: Network toxicology and genetic analysis identified five key genes that may explain how monoethyl phthalate exposure could contribute to thyroid cancer development.

articles.title: Deciphering the CAF-LCN2 axis: Key to overcoming anti-PD-L1 immunotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts in lung cancer promote therapy resistance by increasing LCN2 levels, and silencing LCN2 can improve immunotherapy effectiveness.

articles.title: Natural compound 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone mitigates radiation-induced lung injury by suppressing EMT and PI3K/Akt pathway.
articles.summary: A natural compound called 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone effectively reduces lung inflammation and fibrosis after radiation exposure by blocking key cellular signaling pathways.

articles.title: Force coordination distinguishes epithelial and mesenchymal modes of collective chemotaxis.
articles.summary: Neural crest cells migrate differently in epithelial and mesenchymal states, with distinct supracellular force coordination and traction mechanisms during collective chemotaxis.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: The review tracks the growing antibody therapeutic pipeline, highlighting 209 late-stage candidates with potential regulatory review in 2026, predominantly for non-cancer indications.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by influencing immune cell interactions and reducing tumor progression.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Herbal treatment Gushen Antai showed potential for improving early pregnancy outcomes in IVF patients by modulating immune system markers.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary: In urothelial cancer, manipulating the gut microbiome through transplantation, probiotics, or diet may enhance immunotherapy effectiveness by boosting immune system response.

articles.title: Effects of estradiol, tamoxifen, and raloxifene on human temporal lobe cortex astroglial cell spreading.
articles.summary: Estradiol and two breast cancer drugs (tamoxifen and raloxifene) affect how brain support cells spread and change shape in the temporal lobe.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear summary sentence:

Manipulating gut bacteria may improve immune checkpoint inhibitor responses in urothelial carcinoma by enhancing the body's immune system function.

articles.title: The colloidal stability of albumin-based drug delivery systems has a profound effect on tumoricidal activity.
articles.summary: Researchers developed improved albumin-based nanoparticles with better colloidal stability, leading to enhanced paclitaxel drug delivery and increased tumor exposure in cancer treatment.

articles.title: Gut microbiome remodeling induced by microplastic exposure in humans.
articles.summary: Microplastic exposure alters gut microbiome composition, increasing potentially harmful bacteria and reducing beneficial microbes that produce protective fatty acids.

articles.title: NK cell-mediated tumor cell killing by bispecific innate cell engagers induces ADCC-mediated activation of primary human dendritic cells.
articles.summary: Bispecific antibodies targeting NK cells can activate dendritic cells, potentially enhancing the immune response against tumors by priming T cell responses.

articles.title: Mucin-degrading gut bacteria: context-dependent roles in intestinal homeostasis and disease.
articles.summary: Mucin-degrading gut bacteria like Akkermansia muciniphila play complex, context-dependent roles in gut health and disease by modulating microbial ecosystems and host responses.

articles.title: Effect of Ileal Feces Transplantation in Preventing Diversion Colitis and Its Complications Due to Protective Loop Ileostomy in Rectal Cancer Cases.
articles.summary: Fecal transplantation significantly reduced inflammation and tissue damage in patients with rectal cancer who underwent protective loop ileostomy.

articles.title: Development and validation of a predictive model for high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with ICIs.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a predictive model using biomarkers to identify high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by enhancing immune response and offering a promising plant-based therapeutic approach.

articles.title: Engineering nanobodies for drug delivery systems in Alzheimer's disease.
articles.summary: Nanobodies can cross the blood-brain barrier and target Alzheimer's disease proteins, showing promise for developing new therapeutic strategies.

articles.title: Discovery of novel and highly potent XIAP-targeted peptide inhibitors using virtual screening.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered a novel peptide (Peptide-5) that effectively inhibits lung cancer cell growth by targeting XIAP protein with high binding affinity and minimal toxicity.

articles.title: Evaluation of the immunotoxicity of atrazine and its chloro-metabolites: relevance for human cancer.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Atrazine, a common herbicide, appears unlikely to cause significant immune system damage or increase cancer risk at typical human exposure levels.

articles.title: Identification and biological evaluation of benzimidazole-based compounds as novel TGFβR1 inhibitors.
articles.summary: Researchers identified a novel benzimidazole compound (3282-0486) that effectively inhibits TGFβR1 and reduces colorectal cancer cell migration and survival.

articles.title: Clinical characteristics and whole exome sequencing in JAK2V617F- and CALR-unmutated essential thrombocythemia.
articles.summary: In patients with essential thrombocythemia lacking known mutations, whole-exome sequencing revealed previously unidentified genetic drivers of the disease.

articles.title: Elevated C-reactive protein to albumin ratio is a promising predictive biomarker for prognosis in patients with renal cell carcinoma.
articles.summary: High levels of inflammation markers (C-reactive protein to albumin ratio) can predict worse outcomes for patients with kidney cancer.

articles.title: Environmental tobacco smoke exposure and pelvic inflammatory disease: a cross-sectional analysis of serum cotinine.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Exposure to secondhand smoke, as measured by serum cotinine levels, was associated with increased risk of pelvic inflammatory disease in non-smoking women.

articles.title: The P7 peptide antagonizes bFGF-induced malignant behaviors of ovarian cancer by inhibiting MEK/ERK signaling pathway.
articles.summary: A novel P7 peptide blocks basic fibroblast growth factor's ability to promote ovarian cancer cell growth and spread by interrupting key signaling pathways.

articles.title: Human papillomavirus vaccinations' association to childbirth rates.
articles.summary: HPV vaccination did not negatively impact childbirth rates, but may have delayed pregnancy due to sexual health counseling received during screening.

articles.title: Frequency-adjusted daratumumab-based regimen versus bortezomib/dexamethasone in newly diagnosed AL amyloidosis: a matched-cohort study.
articles.summary: A frequency-adjusted daratumumab regimen showed promising results compared to standard treatment for patients with newly diagnosed AL amyloidosis.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: Research tracks the growing pipeline of antibody therapeutics, highlighting 209 late-stage candidates with potential regulatory review in 2026, mostly for non-cancer conditions.

articles.title: Endobronchial ultrasound-guided mediastinal biopsies for the diagnosis of mediastinal diseases: A network meta-analysis.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

A comprehensive review of diagnostic techniques suggests endobronchial ultrasound is highly effective for evaluating mediastinal conditions and lung cancer staging.

articles.title: Clinical effectiveness and impact of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccines in preventing invasive pneumococcal disease among children with risk conditions: A systematic literature review.
articles.summary: PCV13 vaccine showed high effectiveness (83.8-91%) in preventing invasive pneumococcal disease among children with various immunocompromising conditions like sickle cell disease and cancer.

articles.title: Independent prognostic factors predicting survival in multiple myeloma patients post-chemotherapy: a retrospective study.
articles.summary: Low platelet count and high lactate dehydrogenase levels significantly predict shorter survival in multiple myeloma patients after chemotherapy treatment.

articles.title: Leukemia-derived exosomes induce immunosuppression of dendritic cell function via TGFB2-MRPL58 axis.
articles.summary: Leukemia exosomes suppress immune responses in dendritic cells by using a specific molecular pathway, potentially hindering the body's ability to fight cancer.

articles.title: Smartphone-Enabled Cough Detection in Severely Exacerbated COPD: An Exploratory Pilot Study.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a smartphone app that can detect cough patterns in COPD patients to help monitor disease progression and potential exacerbations remotely.

articles.title: Investigation of exercise-mimetic bioactive molecules as modulators of MMP activity and expression in cancer cells.
articles.summary: Certain exercise-mimetic compounds like Icariin and Berberine show promise in inhibiting lung cancer cell growth by targeting matrix metalloproteinases.

articles.title: Berberine derivative C51 modulates cGAS-STING-TIM-3 axis to reverse immune evasion and inhibit lung cancer growth.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative, C51, effectively inhibits lung cancer growth by modulating immune pathways and reversing cancer cells' ability to evade immune detection.

articles.title: Zinc(II)-berberine-based complexes targeting mitochondria exhibit enhanced antiproliferative activity as single drugs or in combination with ABT-199.
articles.summary: Zinc(II)-berberine complexes BerT1 and BerT3 effectively target mitochondrial Mcl-1 protein, inhibiting breast cancer cell growth and inducing apoptosis.

articles.title: The advancements in targeted therapeutic strategies for breast cancer via intervention of natural molecules: An insight into cellular and molecular mechanisms.
articles.summary: Natural compounds like curcumin and resveratrol show promise in targeting breast cancer by modulating oncogenic signaling, promoting cancer cell death, and enhancing treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Genome-wide CRISPR screening identifies CLDN1 as a central node in the anticancer mechanisms of berberine and as a therapeutic target in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Genome-wide CRISPR screening revealed CLDN1 as a key gene influencing berberine's anticancer effects in lung cancer cells, potentially offering a new therapeutic target.

articles.title: Nanoparticle-based approaches for doxorubicin delivery in hepatocellular carcinoma: Current strategies and emerging innovations.
articles.summary: Nanoparticle-based drug delivery strategies can enhance doxorubicin effectiveness and overcome resistance mechanisms in hepatocellular carcinoma treatment.

articles.title: Integrated lipidomics and Chinmedomics reveal the multi-target mechanism of Phellodendri Amurensis Cortex in prostate cancer via lipid metabolism remodeling.
articles.summary: Phellodendri Amurensis Cortex shows promise in targeting prostate cancer by disrupting cancer cell lipid metabolism and transforming the tumor environment.

articles.title: Experimental and clinical insights into the therapeutic potential of Berberis vulgaris and its bioactive constituents in respiratory, allergic, and immunological disorders: a comprehensive review.
articles.summary: Berberis vulgaris shows potential in reducing inflammation and modulating immune responses in respiratory disorders, with promising anti-inflammatory effects demonstrated in experimental and clinical studies.

articles.title: A CD36-Targeting Thermosensitive Berberine Nanogel Blocks Tumor Lipid Hijacking and Potentiates Anti-PD-L1 Immunotherapy in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer.
articles.summary: A thermosensitive nanogel delivering berberine targets CD36 in triple-negative breast cancer, reducing lipid accumulation and enhancing immunotherapy effectiveness.

articles.title: A novel photosensitizer berberine derivative B12 induces apoptosis and suppresses HIF-1α expression in colorectal cancer cells via mitochondria-to-nucleus sequential-targeting.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative B12 effectively targets and kills colorectal cancer cells by generating reactive oxygen species under hypoxic conditions through photodynamic therapy.

articles.title: FOXO: a key target in regulating aging and age-related diseases.
articles.summary: FOXO transcription factors regulate aging by controlling cellular processes like metabolism, stress response, and autophagy, potentially mitigating age-related diseases.

articles.title: Computational evaluation of berberine derivatives as potential modulators of TGF-β signalling in cancer.
articles.summary: Computational research identified modified berberine derivatives that could potentially disrupt TGF-β signaling and improve cancer treatment by enhancing receptor interactions.

articles.title: High-fat Diet-associated Digestive Cancers: Mechanisms, Natural Product-based Therapies, and Drug Development.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Natural compounds from Traditional Chinese medicine show promise in preventing and treating digestive cancers linked to high-fat diets.

articles.title: Berberine overcomes paclitaxel resistance in triple-negative breast cancer by inhibiting HSP90-mediated BRCA1 phosphorylation.
articles.summary: Berberine enhances paclitaxel's effectiveness in triple-negative breast cancer by targeting a protein that helps cancer cells resist treatment.

articles.title: Evaluation of the obesogenic role of betel nut extract in mice and its remediation by berberine and orlistat.
articles.summary: Berberine and orlistat effectively countered betel nut extract-induced obesity and metabolic disruptions in mice, with berberine showing superior results.

articles.title: A Natural LDHA Allosteric Inhibitor Geraniin Suppresses Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Cell Growth.
articles.summary: Geraniin, a natural compound, effectively inhibits triple-negative breast cancer cell growth by targeting a key metabolic enzyme and disrupting cancer cell processes.

articles.title: LITAF-NOTCH2-Bmi-1 Axis Mediates AMPK-Dependent Inhibition of Gastric Cancer Invasion and Metastasis.
articles.summary: In gastric cancer, AMPK activation suppresses tumor spread by upregulating LITAF, which inhibits Bmi-1 through NOTCH2, reducing cancer cell invasion and progression.

articles.title: Integrative Multi-Omics Analysis and Experiments Validation Identify COX5B as a Novel Therapeutic Target for Lung Adenocarcinoma.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered that COX5B could be a promising new treatment target for lung adenocarcinoma, potentially offering hope for patients who do not respond to current therapies.

articles.title: Anticancer, Anti-Inflammatory, and Acute Toxicological Evaluation of the Novel Berberine Derivative BN-7.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative (BN-7) demonstrated potent anticancer effects against non-small cell lung cancer cells and significant anti-inflammatory properties.

articles.title: RAGE signaling pathway in glioblastoma and cognitive decline: Insights into inflammatory mechanisms and therapeutic implications.
articles.summary: By targeting the RAGE signaling pathway, researchers found a potential strategy to simultaneously slow glioblastoma progression and reduce radiation-induced cognitive decline.

articles.title: Structural and functional insights into targeting hTERT G-quadruplex by levo-Tetrahydropalmatine in the non-small cell lung cancer.
articles.summary: Levo-tetrahydropalmatine and its derivatives effectively bind to the hTERT G-quadruplex, suppressing telomerase expression and inhibiting non-small cell lung cancer growth.

articles.title: Bovine serum albumin modified carbon dots and berberine composite promotes tumor mitochondrial dysfunction and apoptosis.
articles.summary: BSA-modified carbon dot-berberine nanocomposite effectively targets tumor mitochondria, induces cell death, and inhibits cancer growth with minimal side effects.

articles.title: A comparative analysis of bioactive phytochemicals in Cynanchum viminale (L.) L. and Pergularia daemia (Forssk.) Chiov. from Saudi Arabian folk medicine.
articles.summary: Cynanchum viminale showed potent cytotoxicity against liver cancer cells by targeting the EGFR protein, with alkaloids demonstrating high-affinity binding to disrupt cancer cell growth.

articles.title: The role of Chinese medicines in targeting non-coding RNAs to overcome cancer drug resistance: Mechanisms and clinical translation challenges.
articles.summary: Chinese medicines show promise in targeting non-coding RNAs to overcome drug resistance in cancer by modulating cellular plasticity and signaling pathways.

articles.title: Design, synthesis and anti-breast tumor activity of Berberine hydrogen sulfide donor derivatives.
articles.summary: Researchers developed modified berberine compounds that release hydrogen sulfide and show strong anti-breast cancer activity against MCF-7 and 4T1 tumor cells.

articles.title: Berberine's impact on health: Comprehensive biological, pharmacological, and nutritional perspectives.
articles.summary: Berberine shows promise in treating multiple conditions, including inhibiting tumor growth, reducing colorectal adenoma recurrence, and improving metabolic and cardiovascular health.

articles.title: Inhibitory potential of phytochemicals on species-specific breast cancer resistance protein transport activity.
articles.summary: Certain phytochemicals like apigenin and kaempferol can significantly inhibit breast cancer resistance protein transport across multiple species.

articles.title: Excipient-free self-assembled nanotheranostics enable synchronous sensitization of tumoricidal photothermal and photodynamic therapies through mitochondrial metabolic intervention.
articles.summary: Researchers developed nanoparticles combining metabolism-targeting drugs and a photosensitizer to enhance cancer treatment effectiveness by disrupting tumor cell energy production and oxygen dynamics.

articles.title: Study on the mechanism of action of berberine combined with Jianpi Yishen Huazhuo formulation in treating obese polycystic ovary syndrome by activating PI3K/AKT signaling pathway.
articles.summary: The combination of berberine and a Chinese herbal formulation may improve polycystic ovary syndrome in obese rats by enhancing cellular signaling pathways.

articles.title: Targeting Ferroptosis in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma: Mechanisms, Resistance, and Precision Therapeutic Opportunities.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

In nasopharyngeal carcinoma, targeting ferroptosis mechanisms can potentially overcome therapy resistance by modulating cell death pathways linked to viral infection.

articles.title: Network pharmacology of natural alkaloids: Rewiring the vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear summary sentence:

Natural alkaloids show potential to break the self-reinforcing cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction that contributes to chronic disease progression.

articles.title: Jiao-tai-wan and its component coptisine attenuate PCOS by regulating mitochondrial cholesterol import through suppression of SIRT1 ubiquitination.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Traditional herbal treatment Jiao-tai-wan reduces symptoms of polycystic ovary syndrome by improving mitochondrial function and cellular metabolism.

articles.title: Coptisine regulates PI3K/AKT pathway to block bladder cancer progression: a study based on network pharmacology, in vitro and in vivo assays.
articles.summary: Coptisine, a natural compound, inhibits bladder cancer cell growth by targeting the PI3K/AKT pathway, reducing tumor progression and malignant behaviors.

articles.title: AI-guided design of a CXCR4-targeted core-shell nanocarrier for co-delivery of berberine/paclitaxel in cancer therapy.
articles.summary: AI-designed nanoparticles co-delivering two cancer drugs show promising colorectal cancer therapy by selectively targeting and shrinking tumors without toxic side effects.

articles.title: Plant-derived immunomodulators in cancer: Balancing immune activation and suppression within the tumor microenvironment.
articles.summary: Plant-derived compounds like piperlongumine, berberine, and EGCG show potential to modulate immune responses in cancer by targeting checkpoint proteins and T cell function.

articles.title: Machine learning-powered discovery of a novel berberine derivative inducing SCD-dependent ferroptosis in osteosarcoma.
articles.summary: A new berberine-based drug identified through machine learning effectively kills osteosarcoma cancer cells by triggering a specific type of cell death.

articles.title: Berberine-cucurbit[7]uril complex boosts the antitumor effect of berberine.
articles.summary: A cucurbit[7]uril-berberine complex significantly improved berberine's cancer-fighting ability by enhancing its effectiveness against tumor cells.

articles.title: Berberine sensitizes liver cancer cells to sorafenib by inducing SETDB1/NQO1/p53-dependent ferroptosis and genomic instability.
articles.summary: Berberine enhances sorafenib's effectiveness against liver cancer by triggering cell death through ferroptosis and genomic instability mechanisms.

articles.title: LC-MS/MS based cellular pharmacokinetics to explore the mechanism of palmatine against doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity.
articles.summary: Palmatine reduces doxorubicin's cardiotoxicity by inhibiting drug transport proteins, thereby decreasing the chemotherapy drug's accumulation in heart cells.

articles.title: Potential Health Effects of the Natural Alkaloid Berberine: A Narrative Review.
articles.summary: Berberine, a natural plant compound, shows potential in targeting multiple diseases, including cancer, by exhibiting antitumor and anti-inflammatory properties across various biological pathways.

articles.title: Berberine Induces Ferroptosis and Impairs Migration via Glutathione Peroxidase4/Six-transmembrane Epithelial Antigen of Prostate3 Signaling Pathway in Oral Cancer Cells.
articles.summary: Berberine effectively triggers cell death and reduces movement in oral cancer cells by targeting a specific cellular pathway.

articles.title: AI-based prediction of drug-gene interactions modulating tight junction integrity: A deep learning framework highlighting multiple therapeutic targets.
articles.summary: An AI-powered deep learning model can predict how drugs interact with genes to potentially disrupt or restore the cellular barrier integrity in various diseases.

articles.title: A comprehensive review of alkaloids in cancer therapy: focusing on molecular mechanisms and synergistic potential of piperine in colorectal cancer.
articles.summary: Piperine, a black pepper alkaloid, shows promising potential in colorectal cancer by inducing cell death, blocking cancer pathways, and enhancing treatment effectiveness when combined with other therapies.

articles.title: Investigation of phytoconstituents interactions with human Src kinase in a bid to improve cholangiocarcinoma chemotherapy: An in-silico approach.
articles.summary: Apigenin, a plant compound, shows promise as a potential drug for cholangiocarcinoma by effectively interacting with the Src protein and demonstrating stable molecular dynamics.

articles.title: Optimizing blood-brain barrier permeability: the effect of wine processing on alkaloids in Phellodendri Chinensis Cortex.
articles.summary: Wine processing of Phellodendri Chinensis Cortex significantly improves blood-brain barrier permeability of key alkaloids, potentially enhancing brain drug delivery mechanisms.

articles.title: Thyroid cancer: From molecular insights to therapy (Review).
articles.summary: Molecular insights reveal distinct genetic and metabolic alterations across thyroid cancer subtypes, guiding targeted therapies and personalized diagnostic strategies.

articles.title: Sirtuins as mediators and targets of arsenic toxicity: unraveling signaling pathway crosstalk.
articles.summary: Sirtuins may help mitigate arsenic-induced cellular damage by restoring antioxidant defenses and metabolic function, particularly in acute promyelocytic leukemia.

articles.title: Computational analysis of ligands from natural products on the cellular targets of combined hepatocellular carcinoma and cholangiocarcinoma.
articles.summary: Gossypol and berberine from natural plants show promising potential as targeted therapies for combined hepatocellular and cholangiocarcinoma by effectively binding to multiple cell receptors.

articles.title: Potential of Apigenin, Berberine, Chrysin, and Luteolin to Overcome Doxorubicin Resistance in Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia HL-60 Cells.
articles.summary: Apigenin, Chrysin, and Luteolin can help overcome drug resistance in acute promyelocytic leukemia by targeting a key cellular resistance mechanism.

articles.title: Berberine-loaded mesoporous silica nanomaterials inhibit pancreatic cancer targeting cancer stem cells.
articles.summary: Nanoparticles carrying berberine effectively targeted and reduced pancreatic cancer stem cells, demonstrating potential for improved treatment of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
